thread.title: Jose Mourinho refuses to confirm Wayne Rooney will be at Manchester United next season
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho refuses to confirm Wayne Rooney will be at Manchester United next season

author: jgordon
title: Jose Mourinho refuses to confirm Wayne Rooney will be at Manchester United next season
text:
ROO MAY GO Jose Mourinho refuses to confirm Wayne Rooney will be at Manchester United next season 
Skipper has drawn interest from the Chinese Super League after falling down the Old Trafford pecking order By JAMIE GORDON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JOSE MOURINHO has refused to confirm Wayne Rooney will be at Manchester United at the end of the season. 
The skipper has attracted interest from the Chinese Super League after falling down the Old Trafford pecking order. Getty Images 3 Wayne Rooney has been largely used from the bench this season and is coming back from injury 
And speaking ahead of tomorrow’s Europa League clash with Saint-Etienne , Mourinho admitted: “You’ll have to ask him. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
“I can’t guarantee that I am here next week, how can I guarantee that a player is here next season? 
“If Wayne does leave, it is not because I want him to leave, that is all I can guarantee. 
“I will never try and push a legend of this club to another destiny.” Related Stories Saint-Etienne vs Manchester United: What is the team news for the Europa League tie? BAck to his roots Wayne Rooney returns to Man Utd training ahead of Saint-Etienne clash after root canal surgery but misses trip to France Team news Manchester United vs Southampton team news: Wayne Rooney and Phil Jones doubtful for EFL Cup final He offers mour than roo Jose promises Marcus Rashford more game time... so is it the end for Wayne Rooney? ROO CAN'T HANDLE THE TOOTH Man Utd star Wayne Rooney major doubt for EFL Cup final as he 'needs emergency tooth surgery' COLEEN BREAK Coleen Rooney axed by fashion giant Littlewoods in favour of 'down to earth' Myleene Klass 
Chinese clubs have until February 28 to get their transfer business done meaning Rooney could still leave before the summer.
